item.title: Fragrance Du Bois opens a temporary store at Tangs in Singapore
item.description: Source: Fragrance Du Bois. Fragrance Du Bois has opened a temporary boutique at TANGS, a major department store in Singapore’s Orchard Road shopping area, until September 4, 2015. This marks their second appearance at TANGS this year. The pop-up offers customers a direct encounter with niche perfumery and showcases Fragrance Du Bois’ fragrances, all made with 100% pure, natural oud. Nicola Parker, Brand Director of Fragrance Du Bois, noted a rising interest in niche perfumery.

item.title: Experience the rich history and art at Apricot Hotel in Hanoi
item.description: Source: Apricot Hotel website. Hanoi’s latest luxury hotel, Apricot Hotel, is now open in the heart of Vietnam’s cultural and political center, with a grand opening planned for later this summer*. The 10-story Apricot Hotel, formerly the Phú Gia Hotel, a renowned gathering place for the city’s elite since the 1920s, holds significant historical weight. This five-star hotel offers stunning views of Hoan Kiem Lake and Hanoi’s Old Quarter. It boasts 123 neo-classical rooms, two restaurants, a lobby lounge, a cafe, a rooftop bar with a heated swimming pool, meeting rooms, a spa, and a fitness center.

item.title: A more nutritious choice of French-Vietnamese cuisine in Tanjong Pagar
item.description: Source: L’euphởriz. The L’euphởriz sautéed beef and spring rolls vermicelli salad (bún bò xào chả giò). L’euphởriz, a Vietnamese eatery located in Singapore’s Tanjong Pagar financial area, serves both lunch and dinner. The name “L’euphởriz” is a clever fusion of “L’euphorie” (French for “euphoria”), “phở” (the famous Vietnamese noodle soup), and “riz” (French for “rice”), hinting at the restaurant’s French-Vietnamese roots. With origins in Saigon, Vietnam, the restaurant later established itself in Paris and played a key role in the three-decade success of Parisian Vietnamese restaurant Dong Huong.

item.title: Toyo Koda will enhance the menus at Le Passage Mohkan Shan
item.description: Source: Le Passage Mohkan Shan website. Le Passage Mohkan Shan, a French-style hotel and restaurant nestled in its own private tea plantation at the base of Moganshan* mountain in China, has appointed Toyo Koda as its new head chef. This strategic hire emphasizes the hotel’s aim to become a premier culinary destination in Asia. Chef Toyo, previously recognized as one of Asia’s top chefs by the San Pellegrino Restaurant Awards in 2013 for his role at Shanghai’s French restaurant Franck, is poised to transform the hotel’s culinary offerings.
